attributes.action: Save our Spencers Road, Crawley Gurdwara from being closed.
attributes.additional_details:
We have exhausted all other avenues to save our Gurdwara. The Government or Parliament have the authority and capabilities to save a community and generation.

Our community will be prevented from praying and unable to practise their religion. This is a big part of our lives and somewhat 350+ members will be secluded.

The Gurdwara has been present and active for 40 years, changed the lives of many and been a source of reformation and vital education.
attributes.background:
We would like you to intervene and prevent our Crawley Gurdwara from being closed and members of the congregation being wrongfully evicted. 
This is a place of worship for over 350+ members.
We are law abiding citizens open to conversation and willing to negotiate to the terms with the land owners

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about this are a matter for the relevant landowners and local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
